alert.note: Alert for Glacier; Toole (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 07 at 2:37PM MST until March 07 at 3:30PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Glacier County in north central Montana... Central Toole County in north central Montana... * Until 330 PM MST. * At 235 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along highway 2 in Glacier and Toole counties, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Variable visibility down to a quarter mile or less and slippery roads could result in hazardous driving conditions. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 355 and 379. Highway 2 between mile markers 198 and 305. Highway 89 between mile markers 1 and 23, and between mile markers 89 and 110. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Cut Bank, Browning, East Glacier Park Village, North Browning, Kiowa, South Browning, East Glacier Park, Ethridge, Galata, Starr School, Devon, Dunkirk and Marias Pass. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
